title: Polygon - nullnull response tracing tx
body:
Erigon version: v0.0.6 https://github.com/maticnetwork/erigon/releases/tag/v0.0.6
Commit hash: [d9c5a01](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/commit/d9c5a01103912a64b31c01afac05ab62dfa5c65d)
Chain/Network: Polygon/Matic

When tracing on Polygon, Erigon returns an error while bor returns successfully.

Erigon fork for Polygon returns a `nullnull` response on certain blocks.
It doesn't matter the tracer used, default or callTracer returns with same error.
It also says missing block number when it's a transaction what we are passing.

#### Erigon response
```
curl http://xxxx:8545 \
-X POST \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"debug_traceTransaction","params":["0xfde3ac0d79c9bd1b211a1018fa28dd58dc4809718da29d5ba8214aff13f6a77f",{"tracer":"callTracer","timeout":"1200s"}],"id":2368715}'

{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2368715,"result":nullnull,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"missing block number"}}
```

#### Bor response
```
curl http://xxxx:8545 \
-X POST \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"debug_traceTransaction","params":["0xfde3ac0d79c9bd1b211a1018fa28dd58dc4809718da29d5ba8214aff13f6a77f",{"tracer":"callTracer","timeout":"1200s"}],"id":2368715}' | jq

{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 2368715,
  "result": {
    "gas": 0,
    "failed": false,
    "returnValue": "",
    "structLogs": []
  }
}
```

The txn hash used above is a state-sync txn and erigon nodes doesn't have data for old state-sync txns once the blocks are retired ( Older than 90K ), We have recently discovered a fix for this but for that a resync from scratch is required which is currently under testing on my end.

But I know many indexers in graph protocol network who also had same problem and they synced their node from scratch with `--snapshots=false` and after that older state-sync txns were there in the DB.
I have asked indexers from graph protocol network to share a link with `--snapshots=false`, Maybe you can try to recover a node using that and run the same query on that to confirm the same.
Yes, That is something I will surely look into.

> Yes, That is something I will surely look into.

Thank you @0xKrishna.. please see if this can be expedited.  It would be really helpful.

Hi @qk-santi , Sorry for the delay, You know last few days were holidays.

Regarding the issue, I am trying to reproduce this on my nodes but getting
```
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2368715,"result":null}
```

You are getting this on all of your nodes or any specific ?

Hi @0xKrishna!

Based on your comment we thought it would be just a matter of cloning a good Erigon instance and "call it done", but we have seen all nodes at some point answer `nullnull`.
Not all nodes answer incorrectly at the same time, it varies per transaction, but it is always the same set of nodes answering incorrectly for the same transaction.

Listing below a few ones for you to test:
```
0xdc970bb0c869079b9f263b660042eecb84cf3a72238700674cdf340a31971957
0xfa0fb3daa158eb3b89aafbbdfe05fb70cf59d9f8d4402470278fc1d6dc3ef3b1
0x8299a5ad78dc1ab879b7a2326f3f13d0d98150fb576a28b93a94bc571199245b
0xaa17015e7784a3f1e4b0377eb61d4be21968fb6ec43933966e3f14736788bd8a
0x2a2265d143620f06566e6f6f2677bd70c87311fbe342346e3f9f880b066daa19
0xfa0fb3daa158eb3b89aafbbdfe05fb70cf59d9f8d4402470278fc1d6dc3ef3b1
0x59d3453cb0e714353b984b3fcecb08d70645dac7e5175dd0c8b17f880a8825a0
0x26102b097407e9683556d9f826cbe471de24f0fe54b353f3f7bd56524a00895d
```

Okay, Thanks
I will check all these txns on all of my nodes.
@0xKrishna did you happen to find any `nullnull` response with any of the txs above?
@qk-santi Yes, Thanks for the txns, I am able to reproduce the `nullnull` response, Sorry I wasn't able to work on it lately but will take this on priority now.

Is this response fine in case of missing block ?
```
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":2368715,"result":null,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"missing block number"}}
```
Fixed by #7334
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
keeping this open
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
keeping this open for full jsonrpc 2.0 compatibility :D
So no result when there is an error ? That's remaining, Right ?
Yes, that's it, result field and error field can't both exist in JSON-RPC 2.0 ;)

@qk-santi "result field and error field can't both exist in JSON-RPC 2.0" unfortunately we can't provide this guarantee. Because json is no streaming-friendly. And we sometime need stream data - some traces may take 90Gb of RAM - can't afford accumulating all response - so we stream it to client. Of course it must be always valid json (need fix if it's not). But we consciously sacrifice "result field and error field can't both exist in JSON-RPC 2.0" property - to provide better stability, lower ram, lower attack vector, etc... 

not all rpc methods do streaming - but several do.
Thanks @AskAlexSharov! understood then 🙏
